Open Bar Music is the New York based imprint of Oscar P and Jessica Bendig. The label releases commercial albums, provides artist development, distributes music digitally, and has licensed music to: Ministry Of Sound, Ultra, Hed Kandi, Samsung, SonyBMG, Sprint, Nextel, Universal, Manifesto, Rise, EMI, Club Star, Sneakerz, Planet Records, and Bargrooves.

Whilst net-working her way into the music industry, Miss Crazy D has established her self and is now one of the most popular underground dance female Dj's in recent years.  Miss Crazy D prizes her self on being versatile and adaptable, and she always likes to keep her options open. Her taste in music is quite eclectic, ranging from punk/rock to pop/electro/80's soul/funk, all the way through to dance/ underground /progressive /tech /deep/ trance and house music.

 Marvin Gaye - Sexual Healing - Ospina & Oscar P Mix - Motown

About Scott Langely

With 20 years of DJing experience under his belt, Scott Langley is a DJ who is going places. Having played in over 30 countries worldwide and a dab hand in the studio too with 100 productions signed to over 40 labels, he is a man who knows his music. In the UK alone, he has played numerous gigs across the country, at 30 major clubs in London and at one point managed to hold down a staggering 20 residencies. It's no surprise then that he has been selected to represent the legendary dance music brand Global Underground as one of their new official global residents as well as already representing that other world famous brand, Ministry of Sound as their 1 in 4 official World Resident too - a huge privilege if there ever was one!

In Scott's words, ""I love my job, I love my life and music is what i live for! Its what makes me breath and in life you do what you do best and I was born to make people dance". And no wonder life is good, Scott is truly becoming a force to be reckoned with demand both for his studio work and his work in the DJ booth. 2011 is going to be a busy year!

So people of the world be sure to keep your eye out for this up and coming DJ/Producer - a man with a wealth of experience on and off the decks, a Dj who knows how to cut it with the best of them and to make a whole club move.

item.title: Move on Up - Ospina and Oscar P f Jamie Lee Wilson
item.description:
The 3rd single from Oscar P's Time machine album comes with a fully loaded remix package featuring Cortes, Javi Lopez, Kike Bronchal, Silvano Da Silva, Stevie B, Zonum, and unreleased versions by Carmelo Carone, Daniel Forbes & Auxilya. Jamie Lee Wilson is a vocalist-songwriter originally from Australia but now based in London.


THE WORD ON THE STREET IS.....

Christian Scott
Great vocal, love the groove, deep and hot. will rock this weekend.

Marco Soundee
This is a great tune..and I like the original.

Steeve White Netherlands
Rocking

Greg Cuoco - Aqua-Booty
Soulful & smooth - just the way it should be!

Terrance Dizko
Will deffo play on Chicago House FM.

Sam LaBelle -  Badlands  SF
Solid house offering, as usual, from this team. I like the Zonum Dub and the Kike Bronchal mixes the best - Stevie B turns out a nice throw back sound.

Tom Cosyns - Radio Del Sol Belgium
Great Song

Richie @ Untitled Music
 Solid floor tune, plenty of good sounds throughout making just right for the audience!

Lewis  Ferrier - QH Radio, Reelgroove Radio, SS Radio, Pressure Radio
Really nice  vibe on this mix. Overall good package.

Stephan Grondin - Montreal: Stereo - Parking - Unity, Toronto: Fly
Love this vocal track.. very nice groove and vibe.. the Kike Bronchal Remix is the one for me

The Littlemen,  UK
Wicked mixes

DJ Karl - Belguim -  Fun Radio
Will def play it loud.
 
Hot Hands - Switzerland
Great package and great remixes

Kenn Burrola - KRCL 90.9FM
 Oh damn... this is hott!!

Steve Wade - Touchez SF
Stevie B mix is very nice

Photos from Philip Jean at the Poolside Sessions at The South Seas Hotel, Miami Beach

item.title: Time Machine : The Album : Oscar P
item.description:
Oscar P’s Time Machine
 Coming at’cha like a Mack tank, New York DJ Oscar P (originally from the Dominican Republic) just runs you over with his “Time Machine” bringing back the tribal thump and funk of the best of house music from the ‘90s. “In the story line, I build a time machine and I travel back to 1996 and hop to 2009 to visit my favorite clubs of the era... as well as the Djs that played them,” muses Oscar. Tenaglia, Morales, Vega, “It's an adventure.

“Time Machine The Album” pays tribute to the club scene Oscar P came up in, before Obama, before the war, before the Internet, before the itunes store.

A solid line-up of featured guests, production partners and original material breaking down the musical and cultural barriers between classic house, the big room alternative, and Latin influences, “Time Machine” is Oscar P’s first artist driven album in ten years and is actually the 200th release on Open Bar Music.

“Crispified,” the first single from the album “Time Machine” (Out Feb 2009), is a party anthem about international clubbing, co-written with Alex Almeida and co-produced with Davdison Ospina. It features a stacked lineup of remixers for global consumption with vocals by…. oh yes, Oscar P himself."We wrote ‘Crispified’ in Miami at WMC 2008,” notes Oscar. “It took us about seven months to get the track recorded and released due to our schedules.”

The single features a strong package with mixes by D: Fuse & Hiratzka, Benny Royal, Karol XVII & MB Valence, Dj Spin & Troy Manner, Kid Chris, Davidson Ospina, Sirkhan, Colin Sales, Scott Watson, Cortes, Sound Control, Alex Almeida, Blackliquid, Wil Alonso, Juan Kato, & Groovegetters.

 "I do a lot of vocals on this album,” pointed out the writer-producer whose production and remix credits include: Physics, Gala, Kristine Elezaj, The Peech Boys, George Krantz, 2 Unlimited, Swing 52, Arnold Jarvis, Doug Lazy, Kym Syms, & The Beloved, as well as working behind the scenes with acts like Crystal Waters, 2 In A Room and Lidell Townsell back when dance artists went gold and platinum. "So even people who know me will be a bit surprised.”

There’s also the much buzzed about title track of the album "Time Machine,"  which is slated to become the second single off the CD.

“Today’s generation missed this entire period of NY house,” Oscar points out, “so it was an impulse track.” I heard Mike Dunn's track plugging the Chicago pioneers and it inspired me to plug the guys I grew up with and represent New York. Thanks Mike, see what you started?"

The album features Jaime Lee Wilson, Christian Alvarez, Tyrah Morena, Blackliquid, Physics, Marco Petralia as well as Open Bar Music standout Ama Zedrey. Oscar's label Open Bar has also seen success worldwide combining the right artists & remixers on releases by Black Fras, Stadi, Masi & Mello, Angel Manuel, featuring the work of Tom Novy, Davidson Ospina, MTV & Mark Knight, Big World, Richard F, Granite & Phunk, Rulers Of The Deep, Groove Junkies, Knee Deep, Sueno Soul, & Solitaire. So what’s the secret?

Oscar P points to a great team including, long time partner Carlos Ortiz, online specialist Jessica Bendig and in-studio collaborator Davidson Ospina credited with bringing Oscar back to the recording studio after a five-year retirement.

Oscar credits Davidson for getting him excited about making music again. "I had been quiet for many years just running the marketing company, Media Services NYC and our record labels, Rumba Jams and Open Bar Music with my partner Carlos Ortiz. I was still traveling and active as a DJ, so being in the studio really didn't interest me the way it does today. "

"I've worked with a lot of talented people, and that certainly rubs off on you and gives you the itch,” admits Oscarwho also highlights his twenty year production track record before folks forget that he’s a DJ and producer first before becoming a label president.

more info at

item.title: Open Bar TV Live @ ADE in Amsterdam
item.description:
Open Bar TV Live @ ADE in Amsterdam
Oscar P invades the Nederlands, to get the scoop on the Amsterdam Dance Event, & the parties. A look inside the meeting rooms where the biggest music deals get made. Featuring appearances from Sheeretha Campbell, Jodee Kitch, MC Pryme, Kid Massive, Ivan Robles, Amir Barbell, Jordan Rivera, Juan Atkins, Gene Farris, Davidson Ospina, Phuture 303, Darren Holland, Keith Thompson, Cevin Fisher, Rishi Bass and a visit to the MN2S ADE party.
Special thanks to Subversive, Deejaybooking.com, Fette Shjt, and Radio Decibel.

item.title: Fette Sjit - Live from Amsterdam
item.description:
DJ Jodee Kitch & Mc Pryme host DJ Oscar P live from the coffee shop.... part two! Fette Sjit's Kitch & Corneille (aka DJ Jodee Kitch & Mc Pryme), features a different guest DJ every week, with a strong emphasis on local and internationally acclaimed DJs. Laced with interviews and guest-related music news the show is an absolute must bringing cutting edge minimal, techno, electro, progressive and deep house to the greater Amsterdam area. The show which translated into English means "Phat Shit," is aired on 94.9 FM and streamed on www.decibel.fm for the rest of the world.
Deejaybooking.com & Radio Decibel Presents "Fette Sjit" Oct 23-25 @ ADE (Amsterdam Dance Event) Premier DJ talent agency Deejaybooking.com will team up with Amsterdam's largest radio station Radio Decibel Amsterdam 94.9 FM, to produce 3 showcases during The Amsterdam Dance Event. "Fette Sjit", one of the leading specialty electronic dance music radio shows which airs on Radio Decibel will co-produce the events which will be held at The Olympisch Stadion. New York based Media Services NYC and The Joint will partner with Netherlands based Bizon, Party Scene and DJ Broadcast for event marketing and promotions. Organizers have also tapped indie upstart labels Open Bar Music and Afro Acid for the closing parties. More Info... CLICK HERE

item.title: “Le Fin du Monde” by Oscar P
item.description:
Photos from the New York 2 Ibzia Tour, Brixton Mass, London, UK June 21, 2008
DJs Oscar P (Open Bar) Davidson Ospina (Ospina Digital) Darren Holland (Baldeelox) headline the terrace.
Ibiza Underground's start of summer party is here...Think shorts, bikinis, beach balls, flip flops, buckets and spades, beach towels... MUSIC FEATURED
Title: “Le Fin du Monde” (Davidson Ospina Rmx) Artist: Oscar P Label(s): Selektor Music, Open Bar Music
 Since 2003 Ospina & Oscar P have embarked on a series of collab's, remixes and joint ventures with their labels Open Bar Music and Ospina Digital. Most recently they have produced remixes for Stereo Mutants, Physics, Sasha Alazy, Black Fras, John Legend, DJ Dove vs. Peech Boys. The CD project, features tracks and unreleased material from Hanna Hais, Sergio Flores, DJ Dove Vs The Peech Boys, Angel Manuel vs. Mr. Fingers, Matt Caseli f/ Slide, Sylvio Valerio, Faz, The Houselovers, Ricardo Lopez, D'Layna, & Frank Carter.

item.title: New York 2 Ibiza Europe Tour Diary
item.description:
Summer tour stops in London, Amsterdam, Belgium, Poland, Philadelphia & Puerto Rico, For more Info Go To: http://www.the-joint.net/NY2Ibiza.htm
 Since 2003 Ospina & Oscar P have embarked on a series of collaborations, remixes, and joint ventures with their labels Open Bar Music and Ospina Digital. Most recently, they have produced remixes for Stereo Mutants, Physics, Sasha Alazy, Black Fras, John Legend, DJ Dove vs. Peech Boys. The CD project, features tracks and unreleased material from Hanna Hais, Sergio Flores, DJ Dove Vs The Peech Boys, Angel Manuel vs. Mr. Fingers, Matt Caseli f/ Slide, Sylvio Valerio, Faz, The Houselovers, Ricardo Lopez, D'Layna, & Frank Carter. 2006-2007 saw the brand tour in Ibiza, Italy, Holland, Colombia, Singapore, Puerto Rico, United Arab Emirates, Miami, New York, Chicago, Philadelphia, Baltimore, St. Louis, Atlanta & Seattle. The album is distributed in America by EsNtion Records, Pino Music in Switzerland and One Trybal S.r.l. via Self Distribution in Italy.

item.title: Open Bar Music w/ DJ Jodee Kitch & Mc Pryme on FetteSjit - Amsterdam
item.description:
Amsterdam - May 2nd - Producer Jordan Rivera arranges a radio interview in Amsterdam with the guys from FetteSjit (Pronounced Fat Sh*t) Radio. A disturbing show so great I have decided to bring them monthly to Open Bar Radio and showcase what these guys are doing in the USA. The radio hosts who do the entire show in Dutch with splashes of English slang when then have guests are the funniest guys I have heard on radio in a long time. They are passionate about the house and club music scene, and it shows in their work.
